intro: Erodium toussidanum, commonly known as the Mediterranean catchfly, is a small annual herb native to southern Europe and western Asia. It typically grows to a height of 10–30 cm and features slender, branching stems covered in fine hairs. The plant produces small, pink or purple flowers that bloom from late spring to early summer. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and often covered in a fine, white powdery coating. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in disturbed areas such as roadsides and fields.
